{/* Hero / Header */}
Software Architecture Case Study

Event Management & Ticketing Platform

Comprehensive, scalable system for event management, real-time ticketing, secure payments.
{/* Quick facts */}
{[ { label: "Microservices", value: "12+" }, { label: "Scalability", value: "10K TPS" }, { label: "Availability", value: "99.9%" }, { label: "Latency", value: "<100ms" }, ].map(stat => (
{stat.value}
{stat.label}
 ))}
{/* Overview / Goals & Requirements */} Project Overview
Key Features:
  • Multimedia Support – Rich event content
  • Dynamic Pricing & Seat Selection
  • Social Media Integration & Sharing
  • Real-time Ticket Tracking
  • Secure, PCI-compliant Payments
  • Post-event Analytics
  • Mobile-first App UI
 Stakeholders:
  • Event Organizers
  • Attendees
  • Payment Providers
  • Marketing Partners
{/* Problem Statement */} Problem Statement

Event management platforms must handle peak sales, flexible event structures, pricing, payments, and multi-user analytics in real time.

The main challenge is balancing adaptive pricing, live inventory, secure payment, social media, and analytics—all while guaranteeing 99.9% uptime with sub-second response.

Key Trade-offs:
  • Consistency vs Availability – Eventual consistency for ticket inventory, strong for payment
  • Flexibility vs Performance – Smart caching and async flows for seat/pricing
  • Security vs Usability – Multi-factor auth, but frictionless attendee experience
 {/* Architecture */} System Architecture
Context View:
System boundaries & integrations – users, payment gateways, socials, analytics.
 Container View:
Technologies: fullstack web/mobile apps, API Gateway, microservices, serverless.
 Component View:
Modules: event mgmt, ticket engine, payment, notification, analytics.
 Deployment View:
Cloud infra: Kubernetes, CDN, multi-region DB, load balancer.
Quality Attributes & Scenarios:
  • Performance: API & ticket updates < 100ms
  • Security: End-to-end encryption, multi-factor auth
  • Availability: 99.9% uptime, multi-region failover
  • Reliability: Automated backup, self-healing clusters
 {/* Patterns & Components */} Architecture Patterns
Microservices:
Independent service per domain, easy scaling & maintenance
 Event-driven CQRS:
Async messaging; fast updates & separation of write/read logic
 API Gateway/BFF:
Optimized APIs for web/mobile, security & traffic handling
 Serverless:
Auto-scaling compute for spikes, reduced ops cost
Component map:
  • Event management service
  • Ticketing engine
  • Payment gateway connector
  • Notification/analytics modules
  • Authentication
 {/* Contribution / Reflection */} Contribution & Results
  • Role: Architected overall views, built ticketing/payment microservices, led stakeholder mapping
  • Result: Platform supports 10K+ concurrent attendees, sub-100ms ticket updates, PCI DSS compliance, 99.9% uptime
  • Reflection: Trade-offs in scalability, security, and performance, improved by contract API, serverless, and multi-region infra
); }
